definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
exotic delicacies/luxury foodstuff from distant locations

sentences.english: The only feasting I do these days is in my dream.
sentences.chinese: 这几天我只能在梦中享受山珍海味了。

sentences.english: In ancient times, an emperor could have delicacies everyday.
sentences.chinese: 在古代，皇帝可以天天享用山珍海味。

sentences.english: A good compliment to fine seafood, even oysters, poultry or light cheeses.
sentences.chinese: 适宜与海味，家禽或轻淡的奶酪相配。

sentences.english: But on the Winter Solstice, he had no appetite for the whole table of nice dishes of every kind.
sentences.chinese: 冬至节，看着满桌的山珍海味却一点儿胃口也没有了。

sentences.english: Finally, all those delicacies from mountain and sea began to nauseate me.
sentences.chinese: 那些山珍海味吃到最后，简直令人翻胃。

sentences.english: Together they enjoyed a rich feast of all the delicacies of mountain and sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起享用了一桌满是山珍海味的盛宴。

sentences.english: But South Korea, like Japan, has a vibrant seafood culture.
sentences.chinese: 但是和日本一样，韩国对海味也是情有独钟。

sentences.english: Do not eat with the wicked man or be greedy for his choice food.
sentences.chinese: 不要与虎视眈眈的人进食，也不要羡慕他的山珍海味。

sentences.english: Our restaurant serves a feast of delicacies.
sentences.chinese: 本饭店山珍海味，一应俱全。

sentences.english: Binhai is also famous for its seafood.
sentences.chinese: 滨海市也以海味而闻名。

sentences.english: What kind of seafood do you have?
Shrimps are a popular type of seafood.
sentences.chinese: 小虾是比较普遍的一种海味。

sentences.english: Shanghai cuisine uses a lot of seafood and fish.
sentences.chinese: 沪帮菜中有大量海味与河鲜。

sentences.english: Eat not with an envious man, and desire not his meats.
sentences.chinese: 不要与虎视眈眈的人进食，也不要羡慕他的山珍海味。

definition: umami, one of the five basic tastes (cookery)
